availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. Taylor (Fayette County, Kentucky, hack driver and livery stable keeper)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, hack driver and livery stable keeper. Kentucky native. Son of Charlotte Taylor. Married to Ellen Taylor. Father of Catherine "Kate" Taylor, James William Taylor, Arabella Taylor, and Ellena Taylor. Hack driver in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1850. Livery stable keeper in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, District 2, p. 198A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 581.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 3, p. 254A.
KYR-0001-004-0986.
